trial_identification.studytitle: Sonographically detected blood inside uterine cavity after cesarean birth: prevalence and clinical correlation.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Transabdominal sonography to detect hematometra in puerperal women attending one week after cesarean birth

interventions.interventions: abdominal ultrasonography to see blood in uterine cavity one week after cesarean delivery and on weekly follow up thereafter till the end of puerperium i.e. 6 weeks after delivery.

primaryOutcome.outcome: disappearance of blood from uterine cavity by trans-abdominal ultrasonography

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Mervat sheikhelarab Elsedeek Omran. Professor of obstetrics and gynecology, Faculty of medicine, alexandria university.
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 649 Elhoreya road, Janaklis, Alexandria, Egypt. post code: 03312

ethicsAndSummary.summary: women attending for post-partum care and wound evaluation one week after elective cesarean delivery were examined by ultrasound to detect the presence of hematometra (blood inside uterine cavity). When present cases were followed up clinically and sonographically till its disappearance or till the end of puerperium.
